name: Camellia
description: A catalyst to opening to new attitudes which reflect one's true inner nature

Camellia is an essence of expansion beyond self-inflicted limitations. It allows us to express the unique aspect of the vital force within us and to align with our own inner power. We can release old thought and behaviour patterns which do not serve us well.

Via the Solar Plexus chakra Camellia releases cell memory of earlier experiences in this life. As a child we may have felt shamed by our inability to do something or by doing something which we were told was bad. This guilt and shame is stored in the Solar plexus chakra where it can run interference in current life experience. Camellia helps us to respond to present experience with gracefulness. It assists the Large Intestine channel to eliminate old feelings, thoughts, and attitudes about ourselves. It accesses self-trust and creates attitudinal shifts. By dissolving our protective armour we can transform into flexibility and openness.

name: Purple Crocus
description: For resolving tension generated from grief and loss

name: Forsythia
description: Provides motivation for the transformation of old patterns

name: Grape Hyacinth
description: For times of external shock, despair, stress

name: Lily of the Valley
description: Allows for freedom of choice by discovering the simplest mode of behaviour

name: Narcissus
description: For identification and resolution of conflicts by going to the centre of the problem/fear

name: Periwinkle
description: Encourages the 'ability to respond' to depression and thereby dispel it

name: Polyanthus
description: Dissolves blocks to abundance consciousness; transforms attitudes of scarcity into ones of worthiness and willingness to receive

name: Snowdrop
description: For letting go, having fun, lightening up

name: Viburnum
description: Strengthens our connection with the subconscious and our psychic abilities

name: Windflower
description: Spiritual tonic: provides grounding and inner security
